intro: Psiadia modesta, commonly known as the modest daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features showy yellow-orange flowers surrounded by white ray florets, typical of the genus Psiadia. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Psiadia modesta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
